description: Revert all stakes to $2 baseline. Recent $10 stakes are creating outsized losses that overwhelm the 86% win rate
reason: With 86% win rate, a $2 stake yields ~$0.17 avg profit per win but -$2 per loss. At $10 stakes, losses become -$10. Last 7 losses cost -$60 total; at $2 stakes would have cost -$14. The math doesn't work at higher stakes until win rate reaches ~92%+

description: Debug trade execution pipeline for race conditions. Trades 96-97 (BTC DOWN, entry 0.835) and 98-99 (ETH UP, entry 0.795) are identical duplicates with timestamps 306ms apart. Verify: (1) Are these duplicate executions or data logging errors? (2) Is the order submission system creating race conditions? (3) Should duplicates be auto-rejected or merged?
reason: Duplicate trades inflate win counts and P&L artificially. If this is a systematic bug, it could mask real performance degradation. If it's a logging error, it corrupts the trade history used for analysis.
